forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 62. West southwest wind 10 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a muted, soft light filters through the clouds, the city at once familiar and dreamlike. The air is cool, with a gentle breeze whispering against the skin, a remnant of the west-southwest winds that promise to carry the scents of the bay into the heart of the city. Fog clings lazily to some of the hilltops, adding a touch of mystery to the skyline, yet visibility remains decent enough to catch glimpses of the Golden Gate Bridge, shrouded but unmistakable in the distance. While the morning is presently more cotton-gray than bright blue, the forecast hints at a slow warming as the day unfolds.

By midday, expect a gradual transition to partly sunny skies that will uplift spirits and tease the horizon with patches of warmth. The anticipated high of 62 is less about heat than it is about a comfortable embrace, inviting light layers that can be shed or added as the sun plays peek-a-boo with the clouds overhead. Today is perfect for strolling through the streets, perhaps with a slow coffee in hand, allowing the city's heartbeat to resonate alongside your own. The thrumming rhythm of urban life intermixes with the subtle tranquility of the fog-laden air, beckoning you to explore the cafes that line the bustling corners or to meander through the parks where the scent of fresh grass mixes with the omnipresent hint of the ocean.
